basic.floral_language:
Acanthocereus tetragonus 'Fairy Castles'
Floriography: strong, kind, persistent.
Succulent stem of the Acanthocereus tetragonus 'Fairy Castles' is oval and palm shaped, thick and juicy. Leaves reduce to long needle spines. Because it is almost care free, Acanthocereus tetragonus 'Fairy Castles' is very popular and could be found on desktop, tea table, bedroom and office.
Acanthocereus tetragonus 'Fairy Castles' requires direct bright sunlight for growth. It blooms in certain conditions. Flower color could be light yellow, orange or pink.
basic.blooming: Succulent plants, sometimes flowers with a short period

maintenance.sunlight: Likes strong light, put in sunny places
maintenance.soil: Peat and akadama mixed in 3:1 ratio

basic.floral_language:
Chimonanthus praecox 
Floriography: pride, strong and faithful 
Chimonanthus praecox blossom proudly in the snow, with orchid, bamboo, and chrysanthemum together referred to as the "four gentlemen" in the flower, has been named as the city flower of Wuhan. 
Chimonanthus praecox plant strong firm and pretty. Leaf blade elliptic, flowers are delicate and cabinet. Color is various, petals of 5 single and double. The fragrance of plum blossom is from bitter cold, a symbol of the Chinese nation strong spiritual quality. 
Chimonanthus praecox blossom like the sunshine, summer noon light should be covered. Because of the north-south differences, flowering in December to April of next year, with the ornamental period 1 to 2 weeks.
basic.blooming: Flowering period November-March, viewing period 1-2 weeks

basic.floral_language:
Aechmea chantinii 'Samuri'
Floriography: auspicious, passionate, lucky.

Aechmea chantinii 'Samuri' is a genus of flowering plants in the family Bromeliaceae, subfamily Bromelioideae. The genus, named for the Swedish botanist, zoologist, and anatomist Gustaf Johan Billberg. Leaves of Aechmea chantinii 'Samuri' smooth and orderly arranged as a loose lotus flower. Inflorescence, growing from the middle of leaves, composes of bright colorful bracts and build a unique shape. Aechmea chantinii 'Samuri' plants are widely grew in flower beds and family yards.

These plants grow best in mild sunlight. Bright sunlight should be avoided. Bloom in winter and spring for one to two months.
basic.blooming: Flowering period mainly in winter and spring, viewing period 1-2 months

maintenance.watering: Like moist environments, water thoroughly when soil is dry, water every day in summer, reduce water in winter

Aeonium arboreum
Floriography: elegant, blessed, beautiful
Is a large succulent. Has a classical and graceful appearance with green oval leaves in a rosette-like arrangement, leaf edges are serrated and turn red under abundant sunlight.
Likes adequate light, takes a short sleep under summer high temperatures, need take a shelter and reduce watering. Blooms sometimes with orange flowers.

basic.floral_language:
Aeonium arboreum 'Atropureum'
Floriography: mysterious, beautiful, strong.
The tree aeonium is succulent plant with treelike stem. Rosette ordered leaves are dark purple, wide oval, thin, leathery and toothed at edges. Leaves turn into green if not sunbath well. It is very popular because of shape and color of the leaves.
The plant requires sunny habitat. It will go through dormancy in summer and should be remove from direct sunlight to a place with scattered light. Small blooms are yellow if flowered.

basic.floral_language:
Aeonium decorum f. variegata
Floriography: bright, sunshine, beautiful 
Aeonium decorum f. variegata plant stature like the lotus. The flat blade is ovate, with short white hairs on the margin. The color of new leaves is pale yellow, with a small amount of light green. When sunny the leaf edge will turn orange to pink. In hot summer, the blade will become green, please pay attention to shading and control watering. Because of its bright color, easy care, it is deeply loved by the public. 
Like the sunshine, also is flowering. Plant will produce flower stem in the middle, with pale pink flowers.

basic.floral_language:
Aeonium sedifolium 
Floriography: enthusiastic, interesting, pretty
Aeonium sedifolium is small and cute, green leaves are tightly arranged like a small lotus. When sun light is adequate, leaves have purple marks and turn red with prolonged exposure. Leaf surfaces may be sticky with secreted fluid, which may trap insects and dust, can be washed by water.
Likes sunny days, leaves will close when in summer dormant period, shade properly under scattered light. Flowers sometimes with yellow flowers.

Agastache foeniculum

Agave americana 
Floriography: selfless, fortitude, love.
Agave americana is a compact evergreen succulent plant. Leaves rosulately arranged, triangular or lanceolate with spines at edges. Besides ornamental cultivation, its applications include anti-bacteria, anti-inflammation, and etc.
This plant requires much sunlight but should be shaded during the noon of summer. Yellowish green flowers bloom occasionally.

Aglaonema commutatum 'Pseudobracteatum'
Floriography: health, longevity, vitality 
Aglaonema nitidum is a kind of evergreen foliage plants. Because of its sleek large blades it is appreciated by the public. 
Aglaonema commutatum 'Pseudobracteatum' plant stature is elegant, has many branches. Leaf blades are elliptic, slightly leathery, dark green, decorated with white or light yellow patches on the surface, which greatly increase the ornamental value.   Aglaonema commutatum 'Pseudobracteatum' is resistant to shade, is suitable for the scattered light in the bright place. Maintained properly, it also can flower during May and June. Flowers are pale yellow.

basic.floral_language:
Alocasia macrorrhizos 
Floriography: sincere, delicate, pure
Alocasia macrorrhizos is from tropical rain forests, water often drips from the tip of leaf blade.
Alocasia macrorrhizos is an evergreen large plant with heart-shaped hypertrophy leaves in emerald green color. In a warm moist environment, water drips from leaf tips. It must be noted that the plant has poisonous, do not have direct contact.
Alocasia macrorrhizos likes half shaded environments, avoid direct sunlight. It flowers sometimes with flowers with spathe in pale yellow or white.

maintenance.sunlight: Like half shade, put in places with scattered light in summer, flowering time needs a period of 3-5h light

maintenance.watering: Likes wet environments, only need keep soil moist, may spray water in the air or rub leaves with water
maintenance.soil: Peat mixed with coarse sand soil

basic.floral_language:
Aloe arborescens
Floriography: self-respect, tenacious, vital.
Aloe arborescens is a compact evergreen succulent plant. Leaves thick and juicy, long lanceolate shaped with spines at edges. Besides ornamental cultivation, A. vera is popular for anti-bacteria, anti-inflammation, facial and mosquito off.
Aloe arborescens requires sunbath for growth. It would go into short dormancy in winter and should stay warm. Yellow or orange flowers bloom in spring and summer.

basic.floral_language:
Alternanthera ficoidea
Floriography: beautiful, kind, self-love
Alternanthera ficoidea is commonly seen and has bright beautiful leaves. They are tiny plants with oval leaves marked by red, yellow, purple, green, or white stripes, very bright and colorful. Care is simple and can be placed at an indoor corner or in flower beds, or as leaf decoration with bouquets.
Alternanthera ficoidea likes light with some shade tolerance, avoid summer strong light with proper shading. Bloom if conditions are good with white flowers.

maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.watering: Likes wet environments, water thoroughly when soil is dry, may spray water in the air in summer
maintenance.pruning: Remove dead leaves timely

maintenance.sunlight: Likes light, slight shade tolerant

basic.floral_language:
Amygdalus persica
Floriography: confident, innovative, beautiful
It has a strong stem, lanceolate leaf, blooms before leaf growth with delicate 5-petal univalve or multi-layer petal flowers with elegant colors, Since ancient times, beautiful peach flowers attracted the public's eye with its shy and beautiful demeanor. Commonly planted in parks and gardens.
Amygdalus persica likes the sunshine, but shade properly under strong sunlight. Blooming in March-April over 2-3 weeks.
basic.blooming: Flowering period3-4月，观赏2-3周

basic.floral_language:
Anacampseros rufescens f. variegata
Floriography: unique, perseverance, beautiful
Has a beautiful shape and green oval leaves, silk-like hairs grow between leaves, in a cool season with abundant sunlight, leaves are closely arranged, may turn pink, very charming, high ornamental value. 
Likes sunshine, avoid long exposure under direct strong sunlight, has a short dormant period under summer high temperature, place under bright scattered light. Flowers sometimes, pink color.
basic.color: Leaf color green, when sunny leaf color turning to pink
basic.blooming: Succulent plants, sometimes flowers, pink flowers

maintenance.pruning: Remove dead and rotten part timely
maintenance.watering: Resistant to drought, water thoroughly when soil is dry, reduce water in summer
maintenance.soil: Peat and akadama mixed in 3:1 ratio

basic.blooming: Flowering period mainly in winter and spring, viewing period 1-2 months
basic.floral_language:
Ananas comosus cv. Variegata
Floriography: auspicious, passionate, lucky.

Ananas comosus cv. Variegata is a genus of flowering plants in the family Bromeliaceae, subfamily Bromelioideae. The genus, named for the Swedish botanist, zoologist, and anatomist Gustaf Johan Billberg. Leaves of Ananas comosus cv. Variegata smooth and orderly arranged as a loose lotus flower. Inflorescence, growing from the middle of leaves, composes of bright colorful bracts and build a unique shape. Ananas comosus cv. Variegata plants are widely grew in flower beds and family yards.

These plants grow best in mild sunlight. Bright sunlight should be avoided. Bloom in winter and spring for one to two months.
basic.color: Bract orange red, leaf color green, leaf edges light yellow

maintenance.watering: Like moist environments, water thoroughly when soil is dry, water every day in summer, reduce water in winter

maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions,  apply liquid fertilizers once every 10-15 days in summer and autumn
maintenance.pruning: Remove old, diseased, dead leaves and withered flowers timely

basic.floral_language:
Anemone hupehensis var. japonica 
Floriography: sincere, pure and beautiful 
Anemone hupehensis var. japonica is elegant, with the reputation of being "the king of flowers", is the city flower of Luoyang. 
Peony has a large size and beautiful flower appearance. The color is various and it is fragrant. Layered petals is magnificence. Peony is national beauty and heavenly fragrance, with a long history which is through the ages praise peony emerge in endlessly, the beauty of poetry was deeply loved by people all over the world. 
Anemone hupehensis var. japonica like sunshine, natural flowering from April to May, with viewing window for 1 to 2 weeks each flower. When flowers are dying, cut withered flowers and leaves, waiting for spouting next spring.
basic.color: Flower color red, pink, yellow, or in mixture
basic.blooming: Flowering period April-May, viewing period 1-2 weeks

maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply 1-2 times monthly
maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.sunlight: Long-day plant, likes sunshine, but avoid strong sunlight in summer at noon

basic.floral_language:
Anisodontea capensis
Floriography: gentle, pure, beautiful 
Anisodontea capensis is a hardy deciduous shrub. Leaf shape is nearly the diamond, and with wavy sawtooth on leaf edges. Flower is bell shape, with single or double petal. Color is pure and fresh quietly elegant. Color includes white, pink, lavender, etc. Hibiscus syriacus is used as a hedge, hedge or garden ornament and indoor plants. 
Anisodontea capensis like plenty of sunshine, a little resistance to shade. Flowering from July to October, with ornamental period, for 2-3 weeks at a time.
basic.blooming: Flowering period April-November, viewing period 2-3 weeks

maintenance.sunlight: Like adequate light, slight shade tolerance

basic.blooming: Flowers year around with spathe flower, viewing period 2-3 months
basic.floral_language:
Anthurium andraeanum
Anthurium andraeanumFloriography: enthusiastic, bright, bold and unrestrained 
Anthurium andraeanumis one of the world precious flowers, cultivated from the flower kingdom of the Netherlands. 
Anthurium andraeanumflower such as fire, red bud is like a palm, tassel graceful palm a golden yellow flesh, vividly called spathe. Because of their enthusiasm is bold and unrestrained individual character, events like wedding or new store opening, choosing it as decoration, increase the festive atmosphere. 
Anthurium andraeanummaintenance is simple, can bloom all year round, flowering for 2-3 months.

Anthurium andraeanumis one of the world precious flowers, cultivated from the flower kingdom of the Netherlands.

Anthurium andraeanumFloriography: enthusiastic, bright, bold and unrestrained 
Anthurium andraeanumis one of the world precious flowers, cultivated from the flower kingdom of the Netherlands. 
Anthurium andraeanumflower such as fire, red bud is like a palm, tassel graceful palm a golden yellow flesh, vividly called spathe. Because of their enthusiasm is bold and unrestrained individual character, events like wedding or new store opening, choosing it as decoration, increase the festive atmosphere. 
Anthurium andraeanummaintenance is simple, can bloom all year round, flowering for 2-3 months.
basic.blooming: Flowers year around with spathe flower, viewing period 2-3 months

maintenance.pruning: Remove rotten roots, old diseased and dead leaves timely
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply 1-2 times monthly
maintenance.soil: Peat covered with a layer of sphagnum moss on soil surface to keep moisture
maintenance.watering: Likes wet environments, water thoroughly when soil is dry, may spray water in the air or on leaves, reduce water in winter, keep soil moist
maintenance.sunlight: Likes moderate sunlight, resistant to half shade

basic.blooming: Flowers year around with spathe flower, viewing period 2-3 months

basic.floral_language:
Antirrhinum majus 
Floriography: vivid, innocence, beautiful
Antirrhinum majus is an herb, named for the shape of goldfish-like flowers.
Antirrhinum majus stems are erect and handsome, with lively and vivid shape. Flowers have distinct shape, like little goldfish, with various bright color, very popular. Suitable for flower beds or home.
Antirrhinum majus likes ample sunshine, also resistant to half shade, in summer avoid direct sunlight. Blooms in June-October with a period of flower viewing 2-3 weeks.
basic.blooming: Flowering period June-October, viewing period 2-3 weeks

maintenance.pruning: Remove withered flowers, old, diseased, and dead leaves timely
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, dilute fertilizers following instructions,  in early summer, spring and autumn apply fertilizers once monthly
maintenance.sunlight: Like adequate light, resistant to half shade, avoid strong direct light in summer
maintenance.watering: Water thoroughly after soil surface dries
maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients

basic.floral_language:
Armeniaca mume
Floriography: pride, strong and faithful 
Armeniaca mume blossom proudly in the snow, with orchid, bamboo, and chrysanthemum together referred to as the "four gentlemen" in the flower, has been named as the city flower of Wuhan. 
Armeniaca mume plant strong firm and pretty. Leaf blade elliptic, flowers are delicate and cabinet. Color is various, petals of 5 single and double. The fragrance of plum blossom is from bitter cold, a symbol of the Chinese nation strong spiritual quality. 
Armeniaca mume blossom like the sunshine, summer noon light should be covered. Because of the north-south differences, flowering in December to April of next year, with the ornamental period 1 to 2 weeks.

maintenance.pruning: Remove withered flowers, old, diseased, and dead leaves timely
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, top-dressing before and after flowering and defoliation
maintenance.watering: Moderately resistant to drought, water thoroughly when soil is dry
maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.sunlight: Like much sunlight

basic.color: Flower color light pink to red
basic.blooming: Flowering period February-March, viewing period 1-2 weeks

basic.floral_language:
Asparagus setaceus
Floriography: plain, innocent, guileless
Asparagus setaceus is a graceful evergreen foliage plant, with multi-branched soft stems and more tender green, small clusters of short branches in multiple layers with a clear structure, like the clouds, very elegant. Can climb and be arranged into various shape, usually put in the study, living room, to add an air of elegance and charm.
Asparagus setaceus likes a cool, shaded, and well ventilated environment, suitable under the scattered light. With proper care, will bloom sometimes with miniature white flowers.
basic.blooming: Foliage plants, sometimes flowers, white flowers

maintenance.pruning: Remove dead and yellowish leaves timely
maintenance.soil: Peat mixed with coarse sand soil
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply once or twice monthly in spring and autumn
maintenance.sunlight: Resistant to shade, put in places with scattered light
maintenance.watering: Not resistant to drought, water thoroughly when soil is dry, avoid saturated water

basic.blooming: Foliage plants, sometimes flowers, light purple flowers
basic.floral_language:
Aspidistra elatior 
Floriography: goodly, sturdy, vigorous
Aspidistra elatior is an evergreen foliage plant.
Has green, oblong, leathery thick leaves. High ornamental value, usually placed in the living room, desk, foyer, adding a classical atmosphere.
Is a shade-tolerant plant, suitable to be placed under the bright scattered light. When conditions are right. Flowers sometimes with light purple flowers.

basic.floral_language:
Asplenium nidus
Floriography: youthful, optimistic, vigorous
Bird's nest fern is a epiphytic species of fern, evergreen and of high ornamental value.
Bird's nest fern has tender green lanceolate leaves with smooth surfaces and wavy edges. As ornamental potted plants can be placed in the office, living room, or bedroom.
Bird's nest likes half shade environments, in summer and autumn can be placed under bright scattered light, in winter can take 2-3 hours sunlight. Multiplies by spores, no flowers.
basic.blooming: Evergreen ferns, no flowering

maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.watering: Moderately resistant to drought, water thoroughly when soil is dry, water more frequently in summer

maintenance.pruning: Remove dead, yellowish and disease leaves timely
maintenance.sunlight: Likes half shade, suitable in places with bright scattered light, in winter may take 2-3h sunlight

basic.blooming: Flowering period August-October, viewing period 3-4 weeks
basic.floral_language:
Aster novi-belgii 
Floriography: elegant, plain, pure
Aster novi-belgiiis very beautiful. Under sunlight, like dazzling little stars in clusters or clumps.Aster novi-belgii resist cold weather, even frost, therefore loved by the public in the fall season, and are often well loved by the ancient literati. 
Aster novi-belgii like sunny days, mainly blossom in September-November for 3-4 weeks.

basic.floral_language:
Astridia velutina 
Floriography: lovely, exquisite, tenacious
Has fleshy green leaves, thick and juicy, four leaves arranged in opposite directions, like deerhorns, with adequate sunlight, leaves are more compact, otherwise looser and bigger. Likes sunshine, shade properly under summer strong sunlight, does not have an apparent dormant period. Flowers sometimes, white or pink color.

basic.floral_language:
Astrophytum capricorne 
Floriography: strong, kind, persistent.
Succulent stem of the Astrophytum capricorne is oval and palm shaped, thick and juicy. Leaves reduce to long needle spines. Because it is almost care free, Astrophytum capricorne is very popular and could be found on desktop, tea table, bedroom and office.
Astrophytum capricorne requires direct bright sunlight for growth. It blooms in certain conditions. Flower color could be light yellow, orange or pink.

basic.floral_language:
Astrophytum myriostigma
Floriography: charming, lovely, cute
Has a delicate cylindrical shape with 3-9, usually 5, rigid, fleshy, and pronounced vertical ribs forming a star-like shape observed from the top, high ornamental value.
Likes sunny places, shade properly under summer strong sunlight, does not have an apparent dormant period, often blooms in spring and summer. Flowers are light yellow.

basic.floral_language:
Bauhinia blakeana 
Floriography: Bright, strong, warm
Bauhinia is the floral emblem of Hong Kong. Bauhinia is a tree, lofty with many branches, green leaves, nearly round, leaf apex splits from the middle, huge glamorous flowers of purple color, 5 petals and wavy edges. Often used as ornamental trees.
Bauhinia likes sunny places, but shade properly in summer. Flowering from November to next May over 2-3 weeks.
basic.blooming: Flowering period November-May, viewing period 2-3 weeks

basic.floral_language:
Billbergia nutans
Floriography: auspicious, passionate, lucky.

Billbergia nutans is a genus of flowering plants in the family Bromeliaceae, subfamily Bromelioideae. The genus, named for the Swedish botanist, zoologist, and anatomist Gustaf Johan Billberg. Leaves of Billbergia nutans smooth and orderly arranged as a loose lotus flower. Inflorescence, growing from the middle of leaves, composes of bright colorful bracts and build a unique shape. Billbergia nutans plants are widely grew in flower beds and family yards.

These plants grow best in mild sunlight. Bright sunlight should be avoided. Bloom in winter and spring for one to two months.

basic.floral_language:
Calycanthus floridus 
Floriography: pride, strong and faithful 
Calycanthus floridus blossom proudly in the snow, with orchid, bamboo, and chrysanthemum together referred to as the "four gentlemen" in the flower, has been named as the city flower of Wuhan. 
Calycanthus floridus plant strong firm and pretty. Leaf blade elliptic, flowers are delicate and cabinet. Color is various, petals of 5 single and double. The fragrance of plum blossom is from bitter cold, a symbol of the Chinese nation strong spiritual quality. 
Calycanthus floridus blossom like the sunshine, summer noon light should be covered. Because of the north-south differences, flowering in December to April of next year, with the ornamental period 1 to 2 weeks.

maintenance.pruning: Remove withered flowers, old, diseased, and dead leaves timely
maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.watering: Moderately resistant to drought, water thoroughly when soil is dry

basic.floral_language:
Camellia spp.
Floriography: modest, cautious, lovely.
Camellia grijsii ranks the 7th in the top 10 Chinese traditional flowers. The camellia was popular with its graceful plant shape, green oval shaped leaves, bowl shape flowers, a variety of colors (pink, red, yellow, and multi-colors) and subtle elegant scent.
The camellia prefers partial shade. It is best grew in places with bright scatter light during summer and fall, could be moved under direct sunlight during winter. Blooming from October to next May for a duration of three to four weeks.

Floriography: cheerful, enthusiastic, youthful
Has a cute and elegant plant form compared with regular pepper, colorful fruits are bright and lovely, can be green, red, yellow, or purple, very high ornamental value. Full of vitamin C, popular for home vegetable gardening. 
Likes sunshine, shade properly under summer strong sunlight, flowering in June to July, fruit producing from August to winter.

maintenance.pruning: Remove dead and yellowish leaves timely
maintenance.sunlight: Like adequate light, shade properly under summer strong light
maintenance.watering: Resistant to drought, water thoroughly when soil is dry
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply 1-2 times monthly in spring and autumn
maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients, pH value between 6-7

basic.color: Flower color white or purple, fruit color orange
basic.blooming: Ornamental vegetable plants, flowering period June-July, fruiting period August to winter

basic.floral_language:
Caryota ochlandra 
Floriography: blessed, pretty, perseverance
Caryota ochlandra Hance is from sub-tropical regions, but with a tropical flavor. It is a tree, bigger and taller than common foliage plants with thick leaves of fine serrated edges shaped like a fish. Often planted as ornamental trees in the yard, street, and parks.
Caryota ochlandra likes half shade, avoid direct sunlight in summer, while in winter it can take 3-4 hours sunlight. When conditions are right, blooms in May to July with yellow flowers.

maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply 1-2 times monthly in spring and autumn
maintenance.pruning: Remove dead leaves timely
maintenance.sunlight: Like half shade, in winter may take 3-4h sunlight
maintenance.watering: Likes wet environments, water thoroughly when soil is dry
maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients

basic.floral_language:
Centaurea cyanus 
Floriography: elegant, plain, pure
Centaurea cyanusis very beautiful. Under sunlight, like dazzling little stars in clusters or clumps.Centaurea cyanus resist cold weather, even frost, therefore loved by the public in the fall season, and are often well loved by the ancient literati. 
Centaurea cyanus like sunny days, mainly blossom in September-November for 3-4 weeks.
basic.blooming: Flowering period February-August, viewing period 3-4 weeks
basic.color: Flower color blue, purple, rose red

maintenance.sunlight: Likes sunshine, avoid strong direct light
maintenance.pruning: After flowering remove the withered flowers, the part on the ground will wither in winter, the plant germinates again in spring
maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients

basic.floral_language:
Cephalocereus senilis 
Floriography: strong, kind, persistent.
Succulent stem of the Cephalocereus senilis is oval and palm shaped, thick and juicy. Leaves reduce to long needle spines. Because it is almost care free, Cephalocereus senilis is very popular and could be found on desktop, tea table, bedroom and office.
Cephalocereus senilis requires direct bright sunlight for growth. It blooms in certain conditions. Flower color could be light yellow, orange or pink.
basic.color: Green, flower color light yellow, orange, pink
basic.blooming: Succulent plants, sometimes flowers with a short period flowering time 2-3 days

maintenance.soil: Peat and akadama mixed in 3:1 ratio
maintenance.pruning: Remove dead and rotten part timely
maintenance.sunlight: Likes strong light, put in sunny places
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply once monthly in spring to autumn
maintenance.watering: Resistant to drought, water thoroughly when soil is dry, reduce watering in winter dormancy

basic.blooming: Flowering period March-April, viewing period 2-3 weeks
basic.color: Flower color purple red or pink
basic.floral_language:
Cercis canadensis 
Floriography: beautiful, lively, happy 
Tree is the city flower of the Hong Kong special administrative region. Belongs to the deciduous shrubs or trees. Usually is the first flowering after leaf. Purple or pink flowers which are small, tufted on the branches. Looking at the flowers from distance, it is exceptionally beautiful. Usually as a landscape ornamental trees, planted in garden, park, the side of the road or near the house. 
Cercis canadensis like plenty of sunshine, a little dark-resistance. Flowering in March and April, available for viewing for 2-3 weeks.

maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply 1-2 times monthly in spring and autumn
maintenance.sunlight: Like adequate light, slight shade tolerance
maintenance.pruning: Remove withered flowers, old, diseased, and dead leaves timely
maintenance.watering: Water thoroughly after soil surface dries
maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients

basic.floral_language:
Ceropegia woodii
Floriography: romantic, vigorous, tenacious
Has a beautiful shape and climbing growth, leaves in heart shape, slightly fleshy, leaf surface marked by white and dark green colored patches, with abundant sunlight, leaves or even stems turn purple red, Often grow individually as a hanging plant, high ornamental value.
Likes half shaded environments, need shade properly under scattered light and reduce watering under summer high temperature. Flowers when conditions are right, red brown color.
basic.blooming: Succulent plants, sometimes flowers, red brown flowers

maintenance.pruning: Remove dead and rotten part timely
maintenance.soil: Peat and akadama mixed in 3:1 ratio
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions,  apply once every 1-2 months in spring and autumn
maintenance.sunlight: Like half shade, put in places with scattered light, avoid strong direct light
maintenance.watering: Resistant to drought, water thoroughly when leaves become soft, reduce watering in summer

basic.floral_language:
Chamaedorea elegans 
Floriography: tough, beautiful, optimistic 
Pocket coconut is originally from Mexico, and its appearance has a tropical taste. 
Pocket coconut is evergreen four seasons, leaf is lanceolate, resembling a tropical coconut trees, small chic, so called pocket coconuts. 
It is often used to decorate the living room, bedroom, study room, making you feel spring is in the air. 
Pocket coconut likes semi-shaded environment. Avoid direct sunlight. With proper maintenance, it also can have yellow flowers.
basic.color: Leaf color emerald green , dark green
basic.blooming: Foliage plants, sometimes flowering in April-May, yellow flowers

maintenance.pruning: Remove dead and yellowish leaves timely
maintenance.sunlight: Relatively resistant to shade, likes half shade environments
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions,  apply 1-2 times monthly in spring
maintenance.soil: Peat mixed with coarse sand soil
maintenance.watering: Likes wet environments, keep it relatively wet rather than dry, reduce watering in winter

basic.blooming: Blooms once every February-March months, viewing period 2-3 weeks
basic.floral_language:
Champagne mini-rose 
Champagne mini-rose Floriography: enthusiasm, brave and independent
Champagne mini-rose is a rose family, was cultivated in the flower kingdom of the Netherlands.
Champagne mini-rose has various colors, and its fragrance is quietly elegant. Inherited the fine quality of the rose family, but with a stature of cabinet and chic, Champagne mini-rose was popular in Europe market at the beginning of the launch, and has become the new favorite of household and desktop decoration. 
Champagne mini-rose likes the sun light, flowering for 2-3 weeks at a time. Bud sprouts after pruning, and under normal circumstances Champagne mini-rose can be perpetual.

maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.sunlight: Likes sunshine, put in sunny places, avoid strong sunlight in summer at noon
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply 2-3 times monthly
maintenance.watering: Water thoroughly when soil is dry, avoid saturated water
maintenance.pruning: Remove old, diseased and dead leaves timely, after flowering remove the upper part staring from 5 cm above soil surface, leaving 2-3 leaves

basic.blooming: Flowering period November-March, viewing period 1-2 weeks
basic.floral_language:
Chimonanthus praecox 
Floriography: pride, strong and faithful 
Chimonanthus praecox blossom proudly in the snow, with orchid, bamboo, and chrysanthemum together referred to as the "four gentlemen" in the flower, has been named as the city flower of Wuhan. 
Chimonanthus praecox plant strong firm and pretty. Leaf blade elliptic, flowers are delicate and cabinet. Color is various, petals of 5 single and double. The fragrance of plum blossom is from bitter cold, a symbol of the Chinese nation strong spiritual quality. 
Chimonanthus praecox blossom like the sunshine, summer noon light should be covered. Because of the north-south differences, flowering in December to April of next year, with the ornamental period 1 to 2 weeks.

maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.pruning: Remove withered flowers, old, diseased, and dead leaves timely
maintenance.watering: Moderately resistant to drought, water thoroughly when soil is dry
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, top-dressing before and after flowering and defoliation
maintenance.sunlight: Likes sunshine, shade properly under summer strong light

basic.blooming: Foliage plants, sometimes flowers, white flowers
basic.color: Leaf color green, white green and yellow green in mixture
basic.floral_language:
Chlorophytum comosum 
Floriography: tenacious, vigorous, goodly
Chlorophytum comosum is an evergreen foliage plant, like orchids, with long and narrow leaf blades, tender green marked by silver white stripes along edges. Interestingly, a mature spider plant may grow stems among leaf cluster and forming a small plant on the top, becoming lusher. Spider plants are usually placed in the living room, on desks, with an effect to clean air.
Chlorophytum should avoid direct sunlight, placed under scattered light for better care, take sunshine in winter. May have white flowers sometimes.

maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply once every 10-15 days in spring and autumn
maintenance.watering: Likes wet environments, spray water in the surrounding environment to keep air moist, reduce watering in winter
maintenance.pruning: Remove dead and yellowish leaves timely
maintenance.soil: Peat mixed with coarse sand soil
maintenance.sunlight: Relatively resistant to shade, likes half shade environments, leaves are fresh and green with some sunlight in winter

basic.blooming: Foliage plants, sometimes flowers, white flowers

basic.floral_language:
Dendranthema grandiflorum 
Floriography: elegant, plain, pure
Chrysanthemum is the official flower of Beijing in China. The chrysanthemum is one of the "Four Gentlemen" in flowers in Chinese culture (the others being the plum, the orchid, and bamboo). Extremely popular. In Japan, the chrysanthemum is a symbol of the Emperor and the Imperial family.
Chrysanthemum has many cultivars in different beautiful shapes. Under sunlight, like dazzling little stars in clusters or clumps. Chrysanthemums resist cold weather, even frost, therefore loved by the public in the fall season, and are often well loved by the ancient literati. 
Chrysanthemums like sunny days, mainly blossom in September-November for 3-4 weeks.
basic.blooming: September-November flowering period, viewing period 3-4 weeks

maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply 1-2 times monthly
maintenance.pruning: After flowering remove the withered flowers, the part on the ground will wither in winter, the plant germinates again in spring
maintenance.sunlight: Likes sunshine, avoid strong direct light
maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.watering: Keep soil moist, water and drain timely

basic.blooming: September-November flowering period, viewing period 3-4 weeks

Chrysanthemum has many cultivars in different beautiful shapes. Under sunlight, like dazzling little stars in clusters or clumps. Chrysanthemums resist cold weather, even frost, therefore loved by the public in the fall season, and are often well loved by the ancient literati. 
Chrysanthemums like sunny days, mainly blossom in September-November for 3-4 weeks.
basic.blooming: September-November flowering period, viewing period 3-4 weeks

maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.sunlight: Likes sunshine, avoid strong direct light
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply 1-2 times monthly
maintenance.pruning: After flowering remove the withered flowers, the part on the ground will wither in winter, the plant germinates again in spring
maintenance.watering: Keep soil moist, water and drain timely

basic.floral_language:
Cleistocactus strausii 
Floriography: strong, kind, persistent.
Succulent stem of the Cleistocactus strausii is oval and palm shaped, thick and juicy. Leaves reduce to long needle spines. Because it is almost care free, Cleistocactus strausii is very popular and could be found on desktop, tea table, bedroom and office.
Cleistocactus strausii requires direct bright sunlight for growth. It blooms in certain conditions. Flower color could be light yellow, orange or pink.
basic.color: Green, flower color light yellow, orange, pink

maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply once monthly in spring to autumn
maintenance.pruning: Remove dead and rotten part timely
maintenance.watering: Resistant to drought, water thoroughly when soil is dry, reduce watering in winter dormancy
maintenance.sunlight: Likes strong light, put in sunny places
maintenance.soil: Peat and akadama mixed in 3:1 ratio

basic.floral_language:
Clematis alpina 
Floriography: pure, beautiful, tolerant
Clematis alpina has oval or lanceolate leaves, stamens and pistils completely exposed when flowers in full bloom, with elegant colors such as white, purple, pink and so on, single-layer or multi-layer petals. Clematis alpina are generally used for landscaping as hanging or climbing plants to make hedges, walls, fences, arches and others.
Clematis alpina likes ample sunlight, shade properly in summer to avoid strong sunlight. Flowering period January-April for 2-3 weeks.
basic.blooming: Flowering period January-February, viewing period 2-3 weeks

maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, dilute fertilizers following instructions,  in early summer, spring and autumn apply fertilizers once monthly
maintenance.pruning: Remove withered flowers, old, diseased, and dead leaves timely
maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.watering: Water thoroughly after soil surface dries
maintenance.sunlight: Like adequate light

basic.blooming: Flowering period January-February, viewing period 2-3 weeks

basic.floral_language:
Clerodendrum bungei
Floriography: tall, strong and unyielding 
Clerodendrum bungei plants, also known as "ugly peony", "dahongpao". 
Clerodendrum bungei is a shrub, thick green leaves, nearly cordate, margin irregular serrated, colorful. Flower is plump, nearly spherical. Common grown in slope, the side of the road, the bushes. Root and leaf can be used as a medicine, with effects by invigorating the circulation and repelling the stasis etc. 
Clerodendrum bungei likes mild sunshine, semi-shade resistance. Avoid direct light in summer. Flowering in September 7 -, ornamental period of 2 to 3 weeks.

basic.floral_language:
Clivia miniata
Floriography: gentle, humble, benevolent
Clivia miniata is the official flower of Changchun City in China. Has thick, dark green leave oppositely arrange in neat and graceful symmetry, scape emerging from the middle of the blades with funnel-shape flowers on top. Flower color is orange red, yellow, white, and red. Because of it gorgeousness and shade-tolerance, commonly used in home decoration.
Clivia miniata likes half shaded environments, suitable in bright scattered light. Blooms best in January to February or up to 1 month.

basic.floral_language:
Plectranthus scutellarioides 
Floriography: beautiful, kind, self-respect.
Coleus is a common foliage plant for its beautiful leaves. The plant is small and compact. Leaves are oval, toothed at edges with interlaced red, light yellow, purple and green patches on the surface. Grow of the coleus could be as easy as leaving it in a corner. Garden uses are for flower beds or blending leaves for bouquets.
The coleus prefers sunny habitat but direct bright sunlight should be avoided in summer. Light blue flowers may bloom in June to October if growing well.

maintenance.pruning: Remove old, diseased, dead leaves and withered flowers timely
maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients

Conophytum burgeri
Floriography: exquisite, pure, lovely
Very cute and lovely, the whole plant has a half spherical shape, single bodied leaf is bright green, half transparent, shinning like a light bulb, sometimes with a tip, like a volcano, very unique, suitable for growing alone or in combinations with other small succulents. 
Likes sunshine, has a short dormant period under summer high temperature, need shade properly under scattered light. Flowers are purple red.

Convallaria majalis 
Floriography: happy, pure, beautiful.
Lily of the valley is a small herbaceous. Leaves are green, big and round oval. Flowers are small and delicate, bell shaped, drooping. Flower colors are elegant white, pink or blue. Scent is enjoyable and refreshing. Garden uses include flower beds, edges and family pots.
The plant requires partial shade. Scatter light is an appropriate habitat. It blooms in May to June for two to three weeks.

Copiapoa cinerea 
Floriography: strong, kind, persistent.
Succulent stem of the Copiapoa cinerea is oval and palm shaped, thick and juicy. Leaves reduce to long needle spines. Because it is almost care free, Copiapoa cinerea is very popular and could be found on desktop, tea table, bedroom and office.
Copiapoa cinerea requires direct bright sunlight for growth. It blooms in certain conditions. Flower color could be light yellow, orange or pink.

Cotyledon ladismithiensis var. iegata
Floriography: cute, elegant, introversive.
Several "teeth" at the apex of each fleshy, fuzzy leaf give the appearance of "bear claws". Porous soil with adequate drainage. Bright light for best form with ample airflow enables the “bear claws” turning into red. 
The plant prefers sunny habitat. Clusters of yellowish-orange bell-shaped flowers in late spring.

Crassula arborescens Willd
Floriography: broad, inclusive, handsome
Crassula arborescens Willd has thick stems with many branches, leaf blades gray-green to dark-green, inverted triangle shape and fleshy. Leaf color rarely changes, unless under a great diurnal temperature range and strong sunlight the edges become red. Typically used for outdoor and indoor landscaping.
Crassula arborescens Willd likes full sunlight with half shade tolerance, dormant in summer and avoid direct sunlight. May bloom with white to pale pink flowers.

Floriography: passion, vitality, and beauty 
Campfire is a succulent plant, growing in bushes easily to produce collateral branches. The leaves are flat, with short teeth at the edge. The leaf color is yellow green. In cool season and when sunlight is sufficient, leaves turn red, making one feel passionate. 
Campfire like plenty of sunshine, semi shadow resistance. In hot summer, it enters a short dormancy, so place in the shade. It is blossoming from June to July with yellow-white flowers.

Crassula conjuncta
Floriography: stylish, lucky, self-reliant.

Leaves of the C. conjuncta are larger than those of the necklace vine (C. perforata), dark green and thick. Leaf edges are reddish brown or brown if well sunbathed. Leaves stack and offset freely to form large clusters. It is a well-recognized indoor potted foliage plant.

The plant requires sunny habitat. Partial shade tolerant. Summer dormant, protect from direct sunlight. Cream colored flowers bloom in spring.

Floriography: wealthy, lucky, warm.
Crassula marnieriana is a relatively fast growing "stacked" Crassula. Short broad ovate opposing leaves are light green, thick, congested at the leaf tips. Leaf edges turn into red to dark red if well sunbathed. This form has leaf margins that often have reddish tinges and is quite showy.
Crassula marnieriana is a full sun plant and partial shade tolerant. It will go through dormancy in summer and should be remove from direct sunlight to a place with scattered light. It blooms with inconspicuous pale yellow flowers in spring.

Crocus spp.
Floriography: happy, sweet, vitality 
Crocus spp. is also called the saffron, is a kind of dwarf bulb flowers. 
Saffron flowers are usually the goblet shape, elegant delicate, Flower color is rich. Most of saffron has a fragrant smell, and they can be planted in a shallow basin used in indoor decoration. 
Saffron likes the sunshine, also is resistant to semi-shade, the flowering period is 2-3 month, available for viewing for 1-2 weeks. Keep the bulbs for germination in the coming year, and then under normal circumstances it will blossom for many years.

basic.floral_language:
Cryptanthus bivittatus 'Red Star'
Floriography: auspicious, passionate, lucky.

Cryptanthus bivittatus 'Red Star' is a genus of flowering plants in the family Bromeliaceae, subfamily Bromelioideae. The genus, named for the Swedish botanist, zoologist, and anatomist Gustaf Johan Billberg. Leaves of Cryptanthus bivittatus 'Red Star' smooth and orderly arranged as a loose lotus flower. Inflorescence, growing from the middle of leaves, composes of bright colorful bracts and build a unique shape. Cryptanthus bivittatus 'Red Star' plants are widely grew in flower beds and family yards.

These plants grow best in mild sunlight. Bright sunlight should be avoided. Bloom in winter and spring for one to two months.

Cycas revoluta
Floriography: persistence, courage, and progress 
Cycads commonly known as cycas, evergreen in the four seasons, beautiful plant stature, and trunk and roots are strong, leaves are hard, spirally arranged. One of the most famous is the cycas flowering, in the south, generally more than 10 years old cycads will bloom every year, the north cycad is almost a rare flower of appearance in one hundred year. It is usually used in the courtyard to watch or living room decoration. 
Cycads likes mild sunshine, and avoid direct sunlight. Generally difficult to blossom, flowers is orange or light yellow.

basic.floral_language:
Dahia pinnata
Floriography: generous, wealthy, graceful
Dahlia pinnate is graceful and luxurious, revered as the national flower of Mexico, also the official flower of Zhangjiakou City in China.
The flowers have graceful forms with various patterns, such as crab-shape, claw-shape, spherical, conical, ball-shape, etc. Flower sizes vary from 3cm to 30cm, petals closely and neatly arranged. Commonly used in flower beds or home.
Dahlia pinnate prefers sunny spaces, but avoid direct strong sunlight. Flowering from June to November for 2-3 weeks viewing.

basic.floral_language:
Datura innoxia 
Floriography: wise, graceful, fortunate
Datura innoxia has funnel-shaped flowers, like morning glory.
Stout upright stems and broadly ovate leaves with wavy and toothed edges, huge flowers, funnel-shaped or trumpet-shaped in rich colors such as blue, purple, white, pink, etc. Datura innoxia has medical values, but may be fatally toxic.
Datura innoxia likes adequate sunlight. Flowering from May to September for 2-3 weeks.

basic.floral_language:
Chimonanthus praecox 
Floriography: pride, strong and faithful 
Chimonanthus praecox blossom proudly in the snow, with orchid, bamboo, and chrysanthemum together referred to as the "four gentlemen" in the flower, has been named as the city flower of Wuhan. 
Chimonanthus praecox plant strong firm and pretty. Leaf blade elliptic, flowers are delicate and cabinet. Color is various, petals of 5 single and double. The fragrance of plum blossom is from bitter cold, a symbol of the Chinese nation strong spiritual quality. 
Chimonanthus praecox blossom like the sunshine, summer noon light should be covered. Because of the north-south differences, flowering in December to April of next year, with the ornamental period 1 to 2 weeks.
basic.blooming: Flowering period November-March, viewing period 1-2 weeks

maintenance.pruning: Remove withered flowers, old, diseased, and dead leaves timely

Delphinium x 'Black Knight'
Floriography: elegant, plain, beautiful.
The plant is an annual flowering herbaceous. It is very popular because of its plant profile, unique flower shape and various flower colors. Garden uses include flower beds, edges and family pots.
This plant likes sunny habitat. It is partial shade tolerant during growth but requires sunlight during flowering. It blooms in June to September for two to three weeks.

Floriography: elegant, plain, beautiful.
The plant is an annual flowering herbaceous. It is very popular because of its plant profile, unique flower shape and various flower colors. Garden uses include flower beds, edges and family pots.
This plant likes sunny habitat. It is partial shade tolerant during growth but requires sunlight during flowering. It blooms in June to September for two to three weeks.

maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions,  apply 1-2 times monthly in spring
maintenance.pruning: Remove withered flowers, old, diseased, and dead leaves timely
maintenance.watering: Water thoroughly after soil surface dries
maintenance.sunlight: Likes light, half shade when growing, need adequate sunshine when flowering
maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients

basic.floral_language:
Delphinium elatum 
Floriography: elegant, light-hearted, upright
Delphinium elatum belongs to the herbs, has a handsome and graceful plant form, unique flower with colorful colors, similar to Consolida ajacis (Delphinium ajacis, Delphinium ambiguum, doubtful knight's spur, rocket larkspur), often be confused, a closer look will find that Delphinium elatum has hairs in the middle of flower. Suitable for flower beds or home.
Delphinium elatum likes ample sunlight, resistant to half shade, avoid direct strong sunlight. Blooms in May-October for 2-3 weeks.
basic.blooming: Flowering period May-October, viewing period 2-3 weeks

maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.sunlight: Like adequate light, resistant to half shade
maintenance.pruning: Remove withered flowers, old, diseased, and dead leaves timely
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, dilute fertilizers following instructions,  in early summer, spring and autumn apply fertilizers once monthly
maintenance.watering: Water thoroughly after soil surface dries

basic.floral_language:
Dendrobium aggregatum
Floriography: kind, philanthropic, brave.
Dendrobium aggregatum is one of the most widespread ornamental members of orchid family. The blooms are variegated in color, purple or yellow like a number of flying butterflies. It is widely cultivated in indoor pots and flower beds or edges.
Dendrobium aggregatum grows best in partial shade. Bright scatter light is an appropriate habitat. It blooms in April to May for two to three weeks.

maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply once monthly in spring
maintenance.sunlight: Like half shade, put in places with scattered light
maintenance.pruning: Remove withered flowers, old, diseased, and dead leaves timely
maintenance.watering: Water thoroughly after soil surface dries
maintenance.soil: Likes moist and breathable soil, best planted in sphagnum moss

basic.blooming: Flowering period April-May, viewing period 2-3 weeks

basic.floral_language:
Dianthus barbatus 
Floriography: brave, pure, warm
Dianthus barbatus gets its Chinese name 'stone bamboo' from its bamboo-like enlarged stem. 
Dianthus barbatus sports dark green leaves with strips. Single or clustered flowers born on the top of stems. Flowers have five single petals or polyphyll, slightly fragrant, and are of different colors. Commonly used for decoration of flower bed or garden. 
Dianthus barbatus likes abundant sun light. Enters into semi-dormancy in summer, and can be kept in scattered light. Flowers in May through September lasting 2-3 weeks.

maintenance.pruning: Remove old, diseased and dead leaves timely
maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply 1-2 times monthly in spring and autumn
maintenance.watering: Water thoroughly when soil is dry, half dormant in summer, reduce water and fertilization
maintenance.sunlight: Likes adequate sunshine, half dormant in summer, put in places with scattered light

Dicentra eximia
Floriography: sincere, pure and beautiful 
Dicentra eximia is elegant, with the reputation of being "the king of flowers", is the city flower of Luoyang. 
Peony has a large size and beautiful flower appearance. The color is various and it is fragrant. Layered petals is magnificence. Peony is national beauty and heavenly fragrance, with a long history which is through the ages praise peony emerge in endlessly, the beauty of poetry was deeply loved by people all over the world. 
Dicentra eximialike sunshine, natural flowering from April to May, with viewing window for 1 to 2 weeks each flower. When flowers are dying, cut withered flowers and leaves, waiting for spouting next spring.

basic.floral_language:
Dieffenbachia 'Big Ben' 
Floriography: health, longevity, vitality 
Aglaonema nitidum is a kind of evergreen foliage plants. Because of its sleek large blades it is appreciated by the public. 
Dieffenbachia 'Big Ben' plant stature is elegant, has many branches. Leaf blades are elliptic, slightly leathery, dark green, decorated with white or light yellow patches on the surface, which greatly increase the ornamental value.   Dieffenbachia 'Big Ben' is resistant to shade, is suitable for the scattered light in the bright place. Maintained properly, it also can flower during May and June. Flowers are pale yellow.

maintenance.soil: Peat mixed with coarse sand soil
maintenance.pruning: Remove dead and yellowish leaves timely

maintenance.sunlight: Relatively resistant to shade, likes half shade environments
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions,  apply 1-2 times monthly in spring

basic.floral_language:
Dolichothele longimamma 
Floriography: strong, kind, persistent.
Succulent stem of the Dolichothele longimamma is oval and palm shaped, thick and juicy. Leaves reduce to long needle spines. Because it is almost care free, Dolichothele longimamma is very popular and could be found on desktop, tea table, bedroom and office.
Dolichothele longimamma requires direct bright sunlight for growth. It blooms in certain conditions. Flower color could be light yellow, orange or pink.

basic.floral_language:
Dracaena sanderiana
Floriography: good fortune, joy, tenacity 
Lucky bamboo known as transit bamboo is a symbol of prosperous and peaceful. 
Lucky bamboo posture is natural and unrestrained graceful, internodes is like bamboo but not bamboo. Leaf shape is long ovoid to lanceolate, and leaf color is green. Usually as ornamental potted plant, it is put in the living room, desk and bedroom. 
Lucky bamboo likes semi shade. Avoid directly bright light, and place scattered light maintenance. Proper maintenance it will be flowering. Flower color is light purple.

maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, in summer and autumn apply fertilizers once monthly

Lucky bamboo known as transit bamboo is a symbol of prosperous and peaceful. 
Lucky bamboo posture is natural and unrestrained graceful, internodes is like bamboo but not bamboo. Leaf shape is long ovoid to lanceolate, and leaf color is green. Usually as ornamental potted plant, it is put in the living room, desk and bedroom. 
Lucky bamboo likes semi shade. Avoid directly bright light, and place scattered light maintenance. Proper maintenance it will be flowering. Flower color is light purple.

basic.floral_language:
Dracula simia
Floriography: virtuous, tender, intelligent
Dracula simia, commonly referred to as the Chinese orchid, represents simplicity and serenity.
Dracula simia are graceful with slender leaves and colorful, exotic flowers with pure colors and fragrances, though not as huge as the orchids flowers in the West, but very elegant. For its high ornamental value, often used to decorate rooms.
Dracula simia like half shaded environments. Flowering time differs in different varieties throughout the year with a month-long flowering time, promptly cut the scape after flowering for germination in the next year.

maintenance.fertilization: Apply fertilizers every 10-15 days in the growing seasons of spring and autumn, foliar fertilizer spray also do good for its growth , fertilize under 10 ℃ (50 ℉) is forbidden
maintenance.soil: Soil with loose texture or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.watering: Water thoroughly when soil is dry, may spray to the ambient environment in summer, reduce watering in winter
maintenance.pruning: Remove old, diseased and dead leaves timely, remove peduncle after flowering
maintenance.sunlight: Like half shade, in autumn and winter may take 2-3h sunlight, receive more light when leaves are dark green

basic.blooming: Flowering period March-April, viewing period 3-4 weeks
basic.floral_language:
Duranta erecta 
Floriography: keen, warm-hearted, magical
Duranta erecta is an deciduous shrub, often confused with Winter jasmine (Jasminum nudiflorum). Duranta erecta is generally taller with upright branches. Flowering after leaf growth with 4-petal flowers of golden yellow, has elegant aroma. In addition to its landscaping values, it is famous for medicinal values in detoxification, relieving congestion and swelling etc.
Duranta erecta likes sunlight, tolerates half shad, in summer shade properly. Flowering from March to April for 3-4 weeks.

maintenance.pruning: Remove old, diseased and dead leaves timely

Dypsis lutescens 
Floriography: tenacity, beautiful and graceful 
Dypsis lutescens is from the tropics, and its appearance has a tropical taste. 
It is evergreen four seasons. Stem does not internodes, leaves are narrow, lanceolate. Looked from a distance, the tail is like a natural spread out. It is often used to decorate the place such as living room, bedroom and study room. Bamboo palm likes half overcast environment. Avoid directly bright light. Two to three hours sunlight in winter. When condition is appropriate, it may also can blossom in May. Flower color is yellow.

The more abundant sunlight and greater diurnal temperature range, the shinier and blacker the leaves, otherwise in green. Echeveia 'Black Prince' likes sunlight, short period of dormancy in summer, shade properly, sometimes blooms with orange to red flowers.

Echeveria chihuahuaensis                   Floriography: pure, lovely, and delicate 
Echeveria chihuahuaensis plants are small. Leaves are plump and are ovoid shape with small pointed. Leaf surface is with a layer of white powder. When it is sunny and the temperature difference is large in spring and fall, leaf margin will turn red. In hot summer, Echeveria chihuahuaensis will enter a dormant state, so please set it in a cool ventilated place, with less watering in order to survive the summer. 
Echeveria chihuahuaensis like sunny days. If the sunshine is not enough, the leaf will turn green. When it is to flower, the plant produce stems, and it flowers bell-shaped flowers red.

basic.floral_language:
Chimonanthus praecox 
Floriography: pride, strong and faithful 
Chimonanthus praecox blossom proudly in the snow, with orchid, bamboo, and chrysanthemum together referred to as the "four gentlemen" in the flower, has been named as the city flower of Wuhan. 
Chimonanthus praecox plant strong firm and pretty. Leaf blade elliptic, flowers are delicate and cabinet. Color is various, petals of 5 single and double. The fragrance of plum blossom is from bitter cold, a symbol of the Chinese nation strong spiritual quality. 
Chimonanthus praecox blossom like the sunshine, summer noon light should be covered. Because of the north-south differences, flowering in December to April of next year, with the ornamental period 1 to 2 weeks.

basic.floral_language:
Epiphyllum anguliger
Floriography: glorious, warm, distinct
Epiphyllum anguliger flowers beautifully in a very short time window in the night, called a beauty of moonlight.
Epiphyllum anguliger flowers are funnel-shaped, with linear calyx opening together with the flower, very bright and aromatic, after 2-4 hours the flowers close and wither, therefore it represents good luck for the difficulty of seeing its blossom.
Epiphyllum anguliger likes half shade, avoid direct sunlight in summer, in other seasons may increase the illumination time. Often blooms in June to October in the evening with a 2-4 hours time period.

basic.floral_language:
Epipremnum aureum 
Floriography: strong, warm-hearted, optimistic
Epipremnum aureum is an evergreen plant with a tenacious vitality, known as the "devil's vine or devil's ivy" for being almost impossible to kill.
Has hypertrophy, green oval leaves, vines have a strong tendency to twist together, well-developed aerial roots can absorb moisture in the air and nutrients. Epipremnum aureum can be hanged in the room, or as a hydroponic plant.
It likes half shaded environments, place under scattered light.

Euphorbia milii
Floriography: unbending, faithful, loyal
Native to Madagascar, Euphorbia milii is a fleshy plant. Stems in grayish brown color covered with hard and sharp thorns. Green leaves on the top of stem, obovate. Flowers have 2 petals in opposite direction like small butterflies. Euphorbia milii's sap is slightly toxic, should not touch it if grown at home.
Euphorbia milii likes sunshine, but should take proper shade under summer high temperatures. Flowering in October to February for 3-4 weeks.

Fatsia japonica 
Floriography: sincere, lively, riches and honor
Fatsia japonica is evergreen four seasons. Plant stature is big. Leaves are green, larger, and nearly cordate. Blade edges split into eight angle, like the palm of the hand, thus is named as "eight stars gold plate". It can be planted in the park and artificial hills, also can be potted for beautification household. 
Fatsia japonica likes half overcast environment. Avoid direct sunlight. Two to three hours sunshine in winter. It may be flowering, and color is light yellow.

Has a unique appearance and leaves with triangular tips and toothed edges, the teeth are covered with hairs, leaf color light to dark green. In a cool season with adequate light, the leaves turn slightly red. Suitable for being grown alone.
Likes adequate sunlight, sleeps in summer for dormancy, need shade and stop watering. Flowers occasionally with yellow flowers.

Forsythia ovata is an deciduous shrub, often confused with Winter jasmine (Jasminum nudiflorum).Forsythia ovata is generally taller with upright branches. In addition to its landscaping values, it is famous for medicinal values in detoxification, relieving congestion and swelling etc.
Forsythia ovata likes sunlight, tolerates half shad, in summer shade properly. Flowering from March to April for 3-4 weeks.

Freesia
Floriography: happiness, pure, beautiful.

Freesia is a genus of herbaceous perennial flowering plants in the family Iridaceae. It was named after German botanist and doctor Friedrich Freese. Leaves of the plant are elegant long and narrow. Color of flower varies. Bell shaped flowers bloom from bottom to top on the stem are very attractive for viewers.

Freesia plants grow best under mild sunlight. Direct sunlight should be avoid. Blooming in April through May, duration three to four weeks.

Freesia plants grow best under mild sunlight. Direct sunlight should be avoid. Blooming in April through May, duration three to four weeks.

maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.watering: Keep soil moist, water thoroughly when soil is dry
maintenance.pruning: Remove withered flowers, old, diseased, and dead leaves timely
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions,  apply once every 10-15 days in spring
maintenance.sunlight: Likes moderate sunshine, avoid direct strong light, seedling stage and flowering put in places with bright scattered light

basic.blooming: Succulent plants, sometimes flowers, orange red flowers
basic.floral_language:
Gasteraloe beguinii
Floriography: youthful, tough, strong
Is a hybrid with Aloe, has flashy thick juicy leaves, fresh green, triangular shape with long needle like tips, closely arranged in a rosette, rigid and leaf surface covered by white spots, suitable for growing alone or in combinations with other plants in pots.is a common succulent for home, 
Likes sunshine, tolerates to half shade, has a short dormant period in summer, shade properly in a cool environment. Flowers are orange.

maintenance.watering: Resistant to drought, water thoroughly when soil is dry, reduce water in summer
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions,  apply once every 1-2 months in spring and autumn
maintenance.pruning: Remove dead and rotten part timely
maintenance.soil: Peat and akadama mixed in 3:1 ratio
maintenance.sunlight: Likes light, dormant in summer under high temperatures, put in places with scattered light

basic.blooming: Succulent plants, sometimes flowers, yellow flowers
basic.color: Leaf color green to gray green
basic.floral_language:
Gasteria gracilis var. minima
Floriography: peculiar, fortunate, lucky
Has fleshy thick and tone-like leaves arranged in opposite directions forming like an ingot. Leaf color dark green with light green spots. Easy to multiply by detaching lateral buds and burying into soil. 
Likes half shaded environments, avoid direct strong sunlight, need shade properly under scattered light. Flowers are yellow.

maintenance.sunlight: Like half shade, put in places with scattered light, avoid strong direct light
maintenance.watering: Resistant to drought, water thoroughly when soil is dry, reduce water in summer
maintenance.pruning: Remove dead and rotten part timely
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions,  apply once every 1-2 months in spring and autumn
maintenance.soil: Peat and akadama mixed in 3:1 ratio

basic.floral_language:
Chimonanthus praecox 
Floriography: pride, strong and faithful 
Chimonanthus praecox blossom proudly in the snow, with orchid, bamboo, and chrysanthemum together referred to as the "four gentlemen" in the flower, has been named as the city flower of Wuhan. 
Chimonanthus praecox plant strong firm and pretty. Leaf blade elliptic, flowers are delicate and cabinet. Color is various, petals of 5 single and double. The fragrance of plum blossom is from bitter cold, a symbol of the Chinese nation strong spiritual quality. 
Chimonanthus praecox blossom like the sunshine, summer noon light should be covered. Because of the north-south differences, flowering in December to April of next year, with the ornamental period 1 to 2 weeks.
basic.blooming: Flowering period November-March, viewing period 1-2 weeks

maintenance.watering: Moderately resistant to drought, water thoroughly when soil is dry
maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.pruning: Remove withered flowers, old, diseased, and dead leaves timely
maintenance.sunlight: Likes sunshine, shade properly under summer strong light

basic.floral_language:
Gladiolus x
Floriography: passionate, persistent, diligent.

A hybrid of the genus Gladiolus. Gladioli plants possesses graceful style with sword shape leaves. The funnel like flowers bloom from bottom to top gradually with various colors. This flowering order stands a good sign in Chinese culture, career rising up step by step. It is commonly used for flower beds and family yards. It is also widely cultured for cut flowers and ranks among the top four cut flowers because of the big and beautiful flower. 

Gladioli require plentiful sunlight but should be shaded properly in hot summer. Bloom in July to September for two to three weeks.
basic.blooming: Flowering period July-September, viewing period 2-3 weeks

basic.floral_language:
Graptopetalum 'Mirinae'
Floriography: Gentle, generous, beautiful
Graptopetalum 'Mirinae' looks like lotus flowers, leaves smaller than Graptosedum 'Francesco Baldi', oval shape with spine on the tip, green and smooth surface, turn pale pink when light is abundant. Often used in small pot succulent combos for indoor decorations.
Graptopetalum 'Mirinae' loves sunlight, but may be dormant in summer under high temperature, need reduce watering and sunlight exposure. Occasionally blooms with white slightly reddish flowers
basic.color: Leaf color pale green, with adequate sunlight, leaves or whole plants turning to pink
basic.blooming: Succulent plants, sometimes flowers, white slightly red flowers

maintenance.watering: Do not water frequently, keep a dry environment, water every 7-10 days
maintenance.soil: Peat and akadama mixed in 3:1 ratio
maintenance.pruning: Remove withered and dead leaves and excessive daughter plants
maintenance.sunlight: Likes adequate sunshine, when in a short period of dormancy in summer, reduce water and shade properly
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply once monthly in spring and autumn

basic.color: Leaf color green to pink, when sunny leaf color turning to pink
basic.blooming: Succulent plants, sometimes flowers, light red flowers
basic.floral_language:
Graptopetalum amethystinum
Floriography: lovely, exquisite, tender
Has a lovely shape with fleshy juicy leaves in an oval shape, surface covered by a layer of white powders, with slight pink color, looks shy, in a cool season with abundant sunlight, leaves being more closely arranged and color brighter.
Likes sunshine, shade properly under summer strong sunlight, does not have an apparent dormant period. Flowers sometimes, light red color.

maintenance.pruning: Remove dead and rotten part timely
maintenance.soil: Peat and akadama mixed in 3:1 ratio
maintenance.watering: Resistant to drought, water thoroughly when soil is dry, reduce water in summer high temperature
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions,  apply once every 1-2 months in spring and autumn
maintenance.sunlight: Likes light, shade properly under summer strong light, no apparent period of dormancy

basic.blooming: Succulent plants, blooms sometimes, blooms with white flowers in May-pointed star shape, red flower buds
basic.floral_language:
Graptopetalum paraguayense
Floriography: strong, brave, philanthropic.
This plant is a species of succulent plant in the jade plant family, Crassulaceae. Layout of the thick leaves is similar to a blooming Indian lotus. So the plant was called 'the flower never withered' and became very popular.
The plant requires sunny habitat. Flowering occasionally, white, five-pointed star shaped.
basic.color: Leaf color emerald green , light purple

maintenance.soil: Peat and akadama mixed in 3:1 ratio
maintenance.watering: Do not water frequently, keep a dry environment, water every 10-15 days
maintenance.sunlight: Likes adequate sunshine, not afraid of strong sunlight, when in a short period of dormancy in summer, reduce water and shade properly
maintenance.pruning: Remove withered and dead leaves and excessive daughter plants
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply once monthly

basic.floral_language:
Graptosedum “Francesco Baldi”
Floriography: Gentle, generous, beautiful
Graptosedum “Francesco Baldi” looks like lotus flowers, leaves bigger than Graptopetalum 'Mirinae', oval shape with spine on the tip, green and smooth surface, turn pale pink when light is abundant, but not as colorful as Graptopetalum 'Mirinae'. Often used in small pot succulent combos for indoor decorations.
Graptosedum “Francesco Baldi” loves sunlight, but may be dormant in summer under high temperature, need reduce watering and sunlight exposure. Occasionally blooms with white slightly reddish flowers

basic.floral_language:
Graptoveria 'Debbie'
Floriography: beautiful, noble, sweet 
Debbie is small and exquisite, leaves are tight and the surface with a layer of white powder. The leaf color is pink at most of the time which is rare in the succulent plants. When it is sunny, the pink color will darker, in hot summer or when sunshine is not abundant, it will become pink blue. There will be a short dormancy in summer, and please leave it in a cool ventilated place, and reduce watering frequency. 
Debbie like abundant sunshine, high temperature or sunshine deficiency can result in leaf pink blue. When it is blossom, it is flowering bell shape orange flowers.
basic.blooming: Succulent plants, sometimes flowers, red flowers

maintenance.sunlight: A short period of dormancy in summer, use half shade for better care, spring and autumn are its growing seasons, need plenty of sunshine
maintenance.watering: Water thoroughly 2 times during summer dormancy, keep soil moist in other time, water thoroughly when soil is dry
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions,  apply once monthly in spring and autumn
maintenance.pruning: Remove dead and rotten part timely
maintenance.soil: Peat and akadama mixed in 3:1 ratio

basic.floral_language:
Graptoveria 'Silver star' 
Floriography: enchanting, brave, novel
Silver star is a unique hybrid succulent. Leaf shape like pumpkin seeds, closely arranged in rosette, has leaf tips with extended 1 cm long red silk-like filaments, very charming.
Silver Star likes sunny places with half shade tolerance, in summer takes a short sleep, shade properly under scattered light. Flowers sometimes but usually dies after flowering, should cut flower buds off.

basic.blooming: Succulent plants, orange flowers

maintenance.sunlight: Like sunshine, resistant to half shade, a short period of dormancy in summer, use half shade for better care

maintenance.pruning: Remove dead and rotten part timely
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply once monthly in spring and autumn

basic.blooming: Succulent plants, sometimes flowers, yellow flowers
basic.floral_language:
Graptoveria Gilva
Floriography: glamorous, classical, strong
Graptoveria Gilva looks like five-pointed stars, leaves are in melon seed shape, narrower at the ends and wider in the middle, thin and in grayish green, covered by thin layer of white powders. In a cold season with adequate light, leaves turn light purple. Commonly grown alone or in a combination of potted succulents.
Likes sun light, when in a short dormancy in summer high temperature, need reduce water. Blooms sometimes with yellow flowers.

basic.floral_language:
Greenovia aizoon 
Floriography: perseverance, vigorous, beautiful
Greenovia aizoon looks like a flower with green oval leaves of smoothly curved edges. When in summer dormancy, leaves will close tightly, like a rose. Strong reproductive ability, may plant alone.
Likes sunny places with half-shade tolerance, hibernates under high temperatures in summer, should shade properly and stop watering. Flowers sometimes with yellow flowers.

basic.floral_language:
Chimonanthus praecox 
Floriography: pride, strong and faithful 
Chimonanthus praecox blossom proudly in the snow, with orchid, bamboo, and chrysanthemum together referred to as the "four gentlemen" in the flower, has been named as the city flower of Wuhan. 
Chimonanthus praecox plant strong firm and pretty. Leaf blade elliptic, flowers are delicate and cabinet. Color is various, petals of 5 single and double. The fragrance of plum blossom is from bitter cold, a symbol of the Chinese nation strong spiritual quality. 
Chimonanthus praecox blossom like the sunshine, summer noon light should be covered. Because of the north-south differences, flowering in December to April of next year, with the ornamental period 1 to 2 weeks.

basic.floral_language:
Guzmania lingulata
Floriography: auspicious, passionate, lucky.

Guzmania lingulata is a genus of flowering plants in the family Bromeliaceae, subfamily Bromelioideae. The genus, named for the Swedish botanist, zoologist, and anatomist Gustaf Johan Billberg. Leaves of Guzmania lingulata smooth and orderly arranged as a loose lotus flower. Inflorescence, growing from the middle of leaves, composes of bright colorful bracts and build a unique shape. Guzmania lingulata plants are widely grew in flower beds and family yards.

These plants grow best in mild sunlight. Bright sunlight should be avoided. Bloom in winter and spring for one to two months.
basic.blooming: Flowering period mainly in winter and spring, viewing period 1-2 months

maintenance.watering: Like moist environments, water thoroughly when soil is dry, water every day in summer, reduce water in winter
maintenance.pruning: Remove old, diseased, dead leaves and withered flowers timely
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions,  apply liquid fertilizers once every 10-15 days in summer and autumn
maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.sunlight: Like half shade, bright scattered light

basic.blooming: Flowering period mainly in winter and spring, viewing period 1-2 months

Guzmania lingulata 'Red Star' 
Floriography: auspicious, passionate, lucky.

Guzmania lingulata 'Red Star' is a genus of flowering plants in the family Bromeliaceae, subfamily Bromelioideae. The genus, named for the Swedish botanist, zoologist, and anatomist Gustaf Johan Billberg. Leaves of Guzmania lingulata 'Red Star' smooth and orderly arranged as a loose lotus flower. Inflorescence, growing from the middle of leaves, composes of bright colorful bracts and build a unique shape. Guzmania lingulata 'Red Star' plants are widely grew in flower beds and family yards.

These plants grow best in mild sunlight. Bright sunlight should be avoided. Bloom in winter and spring for one to two months.

basic.floral_language:
Gypsophila paniculata 
Floriography: pure, considerate, kind.
Natural habitat of the plant is on the Steppes in dry, sandy and stony places, often on calcareous soils (gypsophila is "chalk-loving"). G. paniculata is a plant with great numbers of small flowers and widely used in the floristry trade providing an effective backdrop for larger or more structured blooms.
The plant grows best with plenty of sunlight. Strong sunlight should be avoided in summer. It blooms in June to August and flower lasts for two to three weeks.

basic.floral_language:
Hatiora gaertneri
Floriography: lucky, fine, tenacious.
Hatiora gaertneri is an epiphytic succulent plant. It grows a number of drooping branches. Each branch comprises of several connection branch sections. This plant usually grows on other trees or damp valleys.
Hatiora gaertneri prefers mild sunlight and is partial shade tolerant. It would go into a short dormancy in hot summer and should be removed to a cool and shaded place. Rose red or red flowers bloom in October to next February.
